com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body

Class ID3v24FrameBodyPositionSynchronization

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.util.Utility
      • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBodyUtility
        • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBody
          • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBodyPositionSynchronization

  • public class ID3v24FrameBodyPositionSynchronization
extends ID3v24FrameBody

    An position synchronization frame body is associated with an ID3v2.4 POSS frame which is used to deliver information to the listener on how far into the audio stream he picked up. In effect, it states the time offset of the first frame in the stream. The position synchronization frame body contains the following fields:

    Position Synchronization Frame Body Fields
     FieldDescription
    1. time stamp formatunits of the position field.
    2. position the position in the audio the listener starts to receive, i.e. the beginning of the next frame.

    There may only be one position synchronization frame in the tag.

    See Also:
    ID3v24Frame, ID3 tag version 2.4.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags

    • Constructor Detail

      • ID3v24FrameBodyPositionSynchronization

        public ID3v24FrameBodyPositionSynchronization()
        The default constructor is called when creating a new frame. The default values used are:
        • time stamp format in milliseconds
        • position 0

        • ID3v24FrameBodyPositionSynchronization

          public ID3v24FrameBodyPositionSynchronization(TimeStampFormat timeStampFormat,
                                      int position)
          This constructor is called when creating a new frame.

          Parameters:
          timeStampFormat - units of the time stamp. see setTimeStampFormat(TimeStampFormat)
          position - position within song

        • ID3v24FrameBodyPositionSynchronization

          public ID3v24FrameBodyPositionSynchronization(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                      int frameBodySize)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
          This constructor is called when reading in an existing frame from an .mp3 file. This is then followed by a call to the parse() method.
          Parameters:
          inputStream - input stream pointing to a position synchronization frame body in the .mp3 file.
          frameBodySize - size (in bytes) of the frame's body.
          Throws:
          java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading in the frame body.

        • setBuffer

          public void setBuffer()
          If the frame body's values have been modified, then resize the raw binary buffer and store the new values there. When finished, the dirty flag is reset to indicate that the buffer is up to date, and the frame is now ready to be saved to the .mp3 file.
          Overrides:
          setBuffer in class ID3v24FrameBody

          Returns:
          a string representation of the frame body.
